title: SEAFORT INT / READING MATERIALS
description: bookshelf with critical theory (communist books) under gun

dialogueTree.title: Reading Materials: "Softcovers, serialized *fantastique..."
dialogueTree.text: Softcovers, serialized *fantastique* and detective stories, 'Animal Adventures', a magazine for electrical engineering, and an international thriller. Also: light erotica and some historical novels from the century past.

links.title: You: "Does anything stand out as unusual?"
links.text: Does anything stand out as unusual?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Oh yes. Under the bed there is a ra..."
links.text: Oh yes. Under the bed there is a rather extensive collection of *critical theory* -- that is: dour, life-non-affirming left wing literature -- published by small imprints such as Abattoir Firm and Ousia. It's not exactly light reading.

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Powerful communist theo..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. Powerful communist theory, rigorous and truthful."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ousia..." he enunciates the word d..."
links.text: "Ousia..." he enunciates the word diligently. "Looks like our straggler has kept some literature around -- for a quick ideological fix."

links.title: Volition: "As usual, he does not respond to th..."
links.text: As usual, he does not respond to the political agitation.

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Deranged commie ranting.""
links.text: "Look, Kim. Deranged commie ranting."

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Downbeat dribble for pe..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done."

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. A book. Left wing. I ha..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- do you?"

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Powerful communist the..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Powerful communist theory, rigorous and truthful."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah. Yeah." He nods, sagely. "Man..."
links.text: "Yeah. Yeah." He nods, sagely. "Man's hooked on the book. Gotta get his fix. Cuno's seen this shit before. Cuno's never getting hooked on that Hjelmdall shit..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "He's probably already hooked on *th..."
links.text: He's probably already hooked on *that Hjelmdall shit*. A kid his age.. that's the best Hjelmdall age.

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Deranged commie rantin..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Deranged commie ranting."

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Downbeat dribble for p..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done."

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. A book. Left wing. I h..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- do you?"

links.title: You: "Hmm... Powerful communist theory, r..."
links.text: Hmm... Powerful communist theory, rigorous and *truthy*!

links.title: Reading Materials: "Your incendiary remark has failed t..."
links.text: Your incendiary remark has failed to stir a reaction in these books.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's hard to get a good argument on..."
links.text: It's hard to get a good argument on -- when your partner gets shot and you're alone.

links.title: You: "Hmm... Deranged commie ranting."
links.text: Hmm... Deranged commie ranting.

links.title: You: "Hmm... Downbeat dribble for people..."
links.text: Hmm... Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done.

links.title: You: "Hmm... A book. Left wing. I have no..."
links.text: Hmm... A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- does anyone else?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Oh yes. Under the bed, there is a r..."
links.text: Oh yes. Under the bed, there is a rather extensive collection of *critical theory* -- that is: dour, life-non-affirming left wing literature -- published by small imprints such as Abattoir Firm and Ousia. It's not exactly light reading.

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Powerful communist theo..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. Powerful communist theory, rigorous and truthful."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ousia..." he enunciates the word d..."
links.text: "Ousia..." he enunciates the word diligently. "I agree -- humanitarian sciences. It stands out. Not a lot of critical theory around in Revachol West..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Your incendiary remark has failed t..."
links.text: Your incendiary remark has failed to provoke him.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wasn't there some in the communist..."
links.text: Wasn't there some in the communist student's room?

links.title: You: ""Kids dig this stuff. There was ple..."
links.text: "Kids dig this stuff. There was plenty of it in the student's room. At the apartment building."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "That one student did have..."
links.text: He nods. "That one student did have some, yes. It's still out of the ordinary."

links.title: You: ""A student in the apartment buildin..."
links.text: "A student in the apartment building seemed to have some as well."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, yes. That one student did.""
links.text: "Well, yes. That one student did."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: Reading Materials: "The little books seem inconsequenti..."
links.text: The little books seem inconsequential next to the big pile of frivolous entertainment covering them.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's making a *strong* comeback. Af..."
links.text: It's making a *strong* comeback. After all...

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Deranged commie ranting.""
links.text: "Look, Kim. Deranged commie ranting."

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. Downbeat dribble for pe..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done."

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim. A book. Left wing. I ha..."
links.text: "Look, Kim. A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- do you?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ousia..." he enunciates the word d..."
links.text: "Ousia..." he enunciates the word diligently. "Humanitarian sciences. Stands out. Not a lot of critical theory around in Revachol West anymore..."

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Powerful communist the..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Powerful communist theory, rigorous and truthful."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah. Yeah." He nods, sagely."
links.text: "Yeah. Yeah." He nods, sagely.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He has no idea what that means."
links.text: He has no idea what that means.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wasn't there some in the communist..."
links.text: Wasn't there some in the communist student's room?

links.title: You: ""Kids dig this stuff. There was ple..."
links.text: "Kids dig this stuff. There was plenty of it in the student's room. At the apartment building."

links.title: Cuno: ""Mhm, yeah. Cool. Detective shit."..."
links.text: "Mhm, yeah. Cool. Detective shit." He seems at a loss as to what to add.

links.title: You: ""A student in the apartment buildin..."
links.text: "A student in the apartment building seemed to have some as well."

links.title: Cuno: ""Mhm, yeah. Cool. Detective shit."..."
links.text: "Mhm, yeah. Cool. Detective shit." He seems at a loss as to what to add.

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The little books seem inconsequenti..."
links.text: The little books seem inconsequential next to the big pile of frivolous entertainment covering them.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Critical theory is making a *strong..."
links.text: Critical theory is making a *strong* comeback. After all...

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Deranged commie rantin..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Deranged commie ranting."

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. Downbeat dribble for p..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done."

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno. A book. Left wing. I h..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno. A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- do you?"

links.title: You: "Hmm... Powerful communist theory, r..."
links.text: Hmm... Powerful communist theory, rigorous and *truthy*!

links.title: Reading Materials: "Your incendiary remark has failed t..."
links.text: Your incendiary remark has failed to stir a reaction in these inanimate objects.

links.title: Logic: "Is this not odd? Not a lot of *crit..."
links.text: Is this not odd? Not a lot of *critical theory* around these days...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wasn't there some in the communist..."
links.text: Wasn't there some in the communist student's room?

links.title: You: "Kids dig this stuff. There was plen..."
links.text: Kids dig this stuff. There was plenty of it in the student's room. In the apartment building.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Sure. Why not. The little books see..."
links.text: Sure. Why not. The little books seem inconsequential next to the big pile of frivolous entertainment covering them.

links.title: You: "A student in the apartment building..."
links.text: A student in the apartment building seemed to have some as well.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The little books seem inconsequenti..."
links.text: The little books seem inconsequential next to the big pile of frivolous entertainment covering them.

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: Rhetoric: "A vulgar materialist reflection. Cr..."
links.text: A vulgar materialist reflection. Critical theory is making a *strong* comeback. After all...

links.title: You: "Hmm... Deranged commie ranting."
links.text: Hmm... Deranged commie ranting.

links.title: You: "Hmm... Downbeat dribble for people..."
links.text: Hmm... Downbeat dribble for people who can't get shit done.

links.title: You: "Hmm... A book. Left wing. I have no..."
links.text: Hmm... A book. Left wing. I have no comments -- does anyone else?

links.title: Reading Materials: "None of these *objects* have anythi..."
links.text: None of these *objects* have anything to add. It's silent in the flak tower.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Still nothing. Just books."
links.text: Still nothing. Just books.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Not that you can tell. This is a di..."
links.text: Not that you can tell. This is a digest of someone who's dead bored. Most of it is for entertainment purposes, fittingly right next to the *radiola* on the floor.

links.title: You: "Nothing? Nothing out of the ordinar..."
links.text: Nothing? Nothing out of the ordinary?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Maybe it's a little old-fashioned?..."
links.text: Maybe it's a little old-fashioned? There's a nude mag? More than that, you can't say.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Hmm... the print in some of these i..."
links.text: Hmm... the print in some of these is pretty small though. This person has good eyesight.

links.title: You: "Okay."
links.text: Okay.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You do feel there's something you'r..."
links.text: You do feel there's something you're not *getting* here, though. Oh well.

links.title: You: ""Critical theory books... What do y..."
links.text: "Critical theory books... What do you think this means?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Again, I am not a philosopher. But..."
links.text: "Again, I am not a philosopher. But whoever has lived here -- they have *some* education. And a certain *set* of interests."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Interesting..."
links.text: Interesting...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Whoever has lived here -- they hav..."
links.text: "Whoever has lived here -- they have *some* education. And a certain set of interests."

links.title: You: ""Critical theory books... What do y..."
links.text: "Critical theory books... What do you think this means?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno doesn't give a shit. Cuno's n..."
links.text: "Cuno doesn't give a shit. Cuno's not hooked on the book. Tryna get me hooked on it, teachers and shit..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "This means we have a critical theor..."
links.text: This means we have a critical theory loving vagrant here... interesting.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Reading Materials: "Books and magazines lie scattered o..."
dialogueTree.text: Books and magazines lie scattered on the floor and on a makeshift cupboard. They are not particularly well organized.

links.title: You: "Sift through them."
links.text: Sift through them.

links.title: Reading Materials: "Most are softcovers: serialized *fa..."
links.text: Most are softcovers: serialized *fantastique* and detective stories from the Twenties and Thirties. This disparate digest includes the classic 'Animal Adventures'.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Popular depictions of man-versus-na..."
links.text: Popular depictions of man-versus-nature by amateur naturalists T. and T. Harpin (husband and wife). Widely read by people from all walks of life. Who doesn't like nature? Who doesn't want to *survive*?

links.title: Reading Materials: "Among what is mostly commercial fic..."
links.text: Among what is mostly commercial fiction and serialized stories, you find a 'Magazine Cathodique' for electrical engineering. Then it's back to pulp: light erotica, an international thriller about circuit benders...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone's made themselves a home."..."
links.text: "Someone's made themselves a home." The lieutenant inspects a softcover.

links.title: Cuno: ""Been readin' shit here," Cuno note..."
links.text: "Been readin' shit here," Cuno notes, thoughtfully. "Hooked on the book."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
